title: Phoenix Arizona - Servers All Down for Cox Communications Customers

embed.description: reddit: the front page of the internet

body: There is a post on Reddit saying that basically the entire Phoenix Arizona area with Cox Communications from east to west is totally down for some reason. Nobody living in the entire valley can connect. Riot has not commented and I have not heard if anyone has called Cox Communications yet.

replies.body:
I'm just seeing this, but heads up that we don't have any jurisdiction over ISP issues.  What I can do is keep an eye out on the situation.  It does sound like a crappy circumstance, and hopefully will get resolved in no time.  The link on the reddit post seems to have been removed, do you have a link to the ISP's status page?  

I recommend bookmarking it if you're impacted by the situation to stay up to date!  I don't really have any information on the situation, but I'll certainly share any details I find.  Thanks for the post!

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/5zeh3b/league_not_logging_in_stuck_on_authenticating/

That is the Reddit posting let me try to find you some information from the ISP itself. I doubt they will make a statement but Ill try to help out and look for a solution. I'll get back to you.
Just as an update, the issue has been made aware and our network guys are looking into it as well.  Thanks for the heads up!

I spoke with a representative at Cox Communications and they dont show any outages in the Phoenix area Nodes. This problem seems to be isolated to Cox Communications only. Other people with different ISPs in Phoenix are able to play. The Cox Rep said they would forward the issue to her manager and hopefully Riot can help us out here too from your end.

I just got back from some testing for a lung transplant and I would really just love to play League of Legends right now to de-stress.

Thank you so much for your help and if there is anything I can do to help you guys as a middle man between the ISP and Riot please let me know.

~ Cael

***UPDATE: The issue seems to have been resolved as of around 9:00 PM PDT last night! If you're still experiencing issues, please take a look at our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) knowledge base. ***



Hey all,

A quick update, it looks like this issue is affecting Cox users around the Southwest Region of the US (Mostly in Arizona.)  We've had some players get around these connection issues by [switching to a Public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#wq5). Our Network Engineers have reached out to Cox as well as quite a few players. 

Since this is happening on Cox's side, there's not a ton we can do to alleviate this. I strongly recommend that you contact your ISP and inform them of this issue.  

I'll post more updates when information is available.
